document.docAuthor: Liu, Zhen, He, Jun-Hua, Chen, Xue-Xin & Gupta, Ankita
document.masterDocTitle: The ater-group of the genus Apanteles Foerster (Hymenoptera, Braconidae, Microgastrinae) from China with the descriptions of forty-eight new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The ater-group of the genus Apanteles Foerster (Hymenoptera, Braconidae, Microgastrinae) from China with the descriptions of forty-eight new species

bibRefCitation.author: Chen, J. H. & Song, D. B.
bibRefCitation.refString: Chen, J. H. & Song, D. B. (2004) Systematic studies on Microgastrinae of China (Hymenoptera: Braconidae). Fujian Scientific Publisher, Fuzhow, 354 pp. [in Chinese with English summary]

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Apanteles latisulca
Chen & Song, 2004: 60
. Holotype ♀ — Fujian , China [FAFU].

subSubSection.paragraph: Diagnosis. Body length 2.5 mm , fore wing length 2.8 mm . Body black, hind femur yellowish. Ocelli large, posterior tangent to anterior ocellus slightly transecting posterior ocelli, distance between fore and hind ocellus slightly short- er than diameter of hind ocellus. Antenna slightly shorter than body length, penultimate flagellomere slightly longer than wide. Interspaces between punctures on disc of mesonotum smaller than its diameter on pronotum. Areola on propodeum closed basally, V-shaped apically, with strong costulae, posterio-lateral parts with numerous irregular carinae. Pterostigma 2.9× as long as its widest part, vein 1-R1 1.2× as long as pterostigma, vein r 1.8× longer than 2-SR, angled at junction. T1 nearly parallel-sided, 2.1× longer than hind width, turned-over part dull, with strong rugosity, longitudinal channel indistinct; T2 shiny and polished, 4.0× wider than long in the middle; T3 2.8× longer than T2. Ovipositor sheath 0.9 length of hind tibia.

Remarks. Characters of the examined specimens mostly agree with the published descriptions except vein 1- CU1 slightly shorter than 2-CU1.
